text: Dadri #lynching is morally repugnant. We need to condemn it without ifs and buts and strange detours into Gandhi's views on cow slaughter.
Where a ferocious @pbmehta tears into Tarun Vijay and the BJP over #Dadri lynching. http://indianexpress.com/article/opinion/columns/the-party-and-its-poison/#.Vg7jezXEkBM.twitter …
@jalebi9 All lives are precious. You should indeed condemn the killing of Hindus too, but not as a means to justify or minimize Dadri crime.
.@malikashok on the Dadri lynching: murder is murder. #India http://www.asianage.com/columnists/murder-murder-509 …pic.twitter.com/G6djZQQxVd

.@desaisantosh: In India, people don't react as much to an event as to the reactions of the other side to it. #Dadri http://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Citycitybangbang/dadri-lynching-the-thin-moral-line/ …

1. Fair to slam Modi for silence on Dadri lynching. 2. Fair also to acknowledge that he's now said the right thing.  http://m.timesofindia.com/india/PM-Narendra-Modi-breaks-silence-on-Dadri-urges-Hindus-and-Muslims-to-fight-poverty-together/articleshow/49273899.cms …
Good that Modi has broken his silence on the Dadri lynching. But he ought to have spoken up sooner. [My take] http://www.wsj.com/articles/a-murder-over-beef-exposes-indian-tensions-1444322291 …
Had Modi spoken up sooner about Dadri he may have forestalled the "irresponsible statements" he wants us to ignore. http://www.wsj.com/articles/a-murder-over-beef-exposes-indian-tensions-1444322291 …

A PM doesn't need to win every argument, but he should always occupy the moral high ground. [My take] #Dadri #India https://www.aei.org/publication/pms-sabka-saath-sabka-vikas-message-is-fading-he-must-climb-back-to-higher-moral-ground/ …

Modi and Dadri: A PM doesn't need to win every argument, but he needs to consistently occupy the moral high ground. https://www.aei.org/publication/pms-sabka-saath-sabka-vikas-message-is-fading-he-must-climb-back-to-higher-moral-ground/ …
